meanings.definition: Not done by choice or intention.
meanings.sent1: The unwilled tears streamed down her face as she watched the sad movie.
meanings.sent2: She felt unwilled to attend the party, but went anyway to support her friend.
meanings.sent3: The unwilled decision to eat the entire cake left her feeling sick.
meanings.sent4: His unwilled absence from the meeting spoke volumes about his dedication to the project.
meanings.sent5: The unwilled smile on her face showed her true feelings about the surprise party.

meanings.sent1: The unwilled gift was politely accepted, even though it was not what she wanted.
meanings.sent2: The unwilled responsibility of cleaning the garage fell to him when his parents went on vacation.
meanings.sent3: She found herself in the unwilled situation of having to share her room with her little brother.
meanings.sent4: The unwilled attention from her classmates made her feel uncomfortable.
meanings.sent5: The unwilled rain on the day of the picnic put a damper on their plans.
